html:
Nov 29 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the business pages of British newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.



The Times


- Motorway, an online used-car marketplace, has joined the ranks of the UK's "unicorn" businesses after securing a $190 million funding round that values it at more than $1 billion. https://bit.ly/3xwToOS


- Centrica CNA.L has ditched its no-frills supply brand British Gas Evolve little more than a year after launching it. https://bit.ly/3rpHFAC


The Guardian


- British shoe retailer Clarks has picked Hong Kong-based investment firm LionRock Capital for exclusive talks to buy a controlling stake in the 195-year-old business. https://bit.ly/3o8Yf69


- Tour operators are scrambling to rearrange Swiss skiing holidays after the country joined Spain in tightening travel restrictions amid rising concerns about the spread of the new Omicron Covid variant. https://bit.ly/315J3NR

The Telegraph


- True Royalty TV secures a distribution deal with Amazon Prime AMZN.O which puts it on track to double subscription numbers next year. https://bit.ly/3ddavMF


- The eurozone's most powerful banking groups have demanded long-term access to London's multi-trillion dollar derivatives trading market in a fresh blow for Brussels' plans to seize business from the City. https://bit.ly/3cYBXgM


Sky News


- Deliveroo ROO.L is close to naming Goldman Sachs GS.N as one of its new brokers, eight months after the Wall Street bank played a major role in what became one of the London stock market's most calamitous listings. https://bit.ly/3I1vRus


- Blackstone BX.N, the owner of Bourne Leisure, Butlin's parent company, has asked bankers at Rothschild ROTH.PA to launch an auction of Britain's best-known chain of holiday camps next year. https://bit.ly/3E3Baaq


The Independent


- British Airways ICAG.L has suspended flights to Hong Kong after a crew member tested positive for COVID-19, amid reports members of the crew were made to isolate for three weeks at a quarantine centre built from shipping containers. https://bit.ly/3cYAEhS



(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))

Keywords: BRITAIN-PRESS/BUSINESS
